slides.title: Welcome to DRuby Demo
content: This slide demonstrates synchronized speaker notes
Open another terminal and run: ruby exe/i_speaker_notes 9000
The notes will update automatically as you navigate
slides.notes: Remember to mention that this is a live demo. Point out how the notes appear in the second terminal window. Emphasize that this is perfect for presentations where you need to keep notes hidden from the audience.

slides.title: How It Works
content: DRuby (Distributed Ruby) enables communication between processes
slides.notes: Technical details: DRuby creates a TCP connection between the main presentation and the notes viewer. The presentation server broadcasts slide changes to all connected clients. This is similar to how modern presentation software handles presenter displays.

slides.title: Use Cases
content: Conference presentations with projector + laptop screens
Practice sessions with timer and notes
Team presentations with shared notes access
slides.notes: This feature is especially useful for professional presentations. You can have your main slides on the projector while keeping detailed notes, timing information, and upcoming slide previews on your laptop screen.
